DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Total Volume Amount Milliliter Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the total amount of sample or specimen, measured in milliliters (mL).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the amount of specimen._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The total quantity or number._A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same._Number that describes the amount of specimen included in the sample._

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The total quantity or number.:A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-Biospecimen
ReferenceDocuments.description: Total amount of  specimen, measured in milliliters (ml).

DataElement.changeDescription: 1/14/22 mr Added alt name, AQT, alt def, ref doc, CSI for MCL Biospecimen per DCT.   Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D.
